id: Lord Alan Sugar calls for cannabis to be legalised ‘to reduce knife crime’
paragraph:

							videoLord Sugar has called for cannabis to be legalised in Britain to drive down levels of knife crime related to drug gangs.The Apprentice star suggested in an interview on Good Morning Britain that Britain’s current approach is like Prohibition in America – which drove up crime and violence.In an interview with Piers Morgan, he suggested that cannabis could be regulated ‘like alcohol and cigarettes’, and that this would lead to a drop in violence.Lord Sugar said, ‘My idea would be, one element of it, if it was legalised it would do away with a lot of gang culture, very similar to Prohibition in America many many years ago back in the 1930s, when alcohol was legalised again it just wiped out the crime and corruption.’Lord Sugar said he changed his opinion during a debate on medical cannabis in the House of Lords.He said, ‘[The debate] kind of prompted me to jump up and ask the whether if marijuana was legalised, albeit very, very heavily regulated, in the same way alcohol and cigarettes are, whether this would put the kibosh on the gangs.’Lord Sugar said that while harder drugs such as cocaine formed part of the problem, he felt that legalising cannabis would solve ‘around 30%’ of the problem.He said, ‘Having said that, there is various elements to it. One is the drugs, two is this one-upmanship, this status thing, where you’re known by your mates for stabbing people.’More: Good Morning Britain
